We explore the implications of an integral transformation \( Z(v) \) on \( z(w) \), defined by \( Z(v) = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} z(w) e^{-ivw} dw \).

Given \( Z(v) \) after applying the transformation \( G(w) \), can we deduce both the original \( \omega \) and the phase shift \( a \) solely from \( Z(v) \)?
Explanation: The outcome \( Z(v) \) provides the magnitude and frequency information but does not independently reveal the phase shift \( a \). The phase shift alters the result in a way that may not be distinguishable solely through \( Z(v) \), necessitating additional information to fully reconstruct the original function parameters.
